The Star Wars franchise has a large and dedicated fanbase, and different episodes are cherished for various reasons. Some fans might argue that the original Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope (1977) holds a special place as the film that started it all and introduced audiences to the iconic characters and the Star Wars universe. Others may prefer Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980) for its darker tone, character development, and one of the most memorable plot twists in cinematic history.
